reviews.review_msg: The number of "uhh" and "umms" made going to lecture borderline impossible. I ended up counting the number of umms in a 50 minute class and he averaged one every 5-6 seconds. Exams started easy but got progressively more impossible as students told him they were too easy.

I think that Mark cared about the students and he genuinely wanted us to succeed. But, he says the word "uhhh" or "umm" every 6-7 seconds on average (I spent a whole class distracted and ended up counting over 300 ums for 50 min class). Further, is he progressively made the tests harder because some students complained they were too easy.
Overall, I enjoyed this class, as the prof was approachable when I needed help. The exams were also quite fair and directly from the lectures.
I would say his class was kind of disorganized, as he did not seem to explain the concepts in the slides super well and the exams tested super minor details.

I can see why Dr. Choy is not rated well. He is not a good lecturer as he does not know his slides or material well at all. Would not recommend the textbook (I didn't end up getting it) and his lectures are honestly not very useful. All that being said, his exams are fair (study the slides) and if you put in the time you will do just fine.

Lectures are not very clear: lots of ums, right, you knows and confusing wordings. No assignments or anything other than midterms and finals, so you are on your own to study for the exams. Exams are hard sometimes.

Yes, he mumbles in lecture but he's actually good at answering students' questions, while not speaking in his usual monotonous voice. If you do end up taking him, don't be afraid to ask questions, even if they are for clarification.

I would not recommend taking mbb 231 with this prof as he made this course tougher than it should have been. When the course shifted to online due to COVID-19 the class was a huge mess and the final was super unfair. Overall, I would avoid this prof.

Prof doesn't seem very enthusiastic in class. He mumbles and stutters the way through. Never held office hours, except for like an hour 2 days before exams. Lecture slides do not help with studying whatsoever. Please wait to take the class with another professor. AVOID.

Slides r copied + pasted out of the textbook. Lectures have extremely poor flow, stutters constantly, monotone, unaware of material b4 class. Slides sometimes just have pictures without any explanation of whats happening. He expects u to memorize ever minuscule detail that he puts in his slides, and tests specifics rather than main ideas. HORRIBLE

Just awful. For a class that has so much potential to be taught with enthusiasm and excitement, this prof did the complete opposite. Lectures consisted of him reading slides off of a screen and not even bothering to actually help us understand/grasp the content. It felt like he was learning the material for the first time as well. Horrible.

Prof doesnt care about student understanding. Notes are copy pasted from textbook. Lecture  reading off slides + LOTS stuttering, mumbling. Tests have few random experimental questions that expect a researcher's level of understanding of material, rest is memorization based. Tip: memorize ALL SLIDES and only use txtbook for pic descriptions.

Final grade is based of just exams (4 exams) and he is in competent. Do not believe the good reviews, he is incapable of explaining concepts or emphasizing ideas that will be in exam. Exams are difficult and I don't think are written by him because they are not testing what we are learning in class. Avoid this prof. Bad. Lectures are super BAD.

Worst prof ever. Cannot maintain class flow and is confused by his own slides (doubt he makes them himself) slides are lazy and full of unimportant text that he will spend hours reading and not test on them. Exam questions are competently random and are no where found on his slides. Cannot explain concepts in class, over email or during office hour

WORST PROF EVER HAD. His lectures are boring, he is a poor speaker, slides are disorganized, full of spelling errors and misinformation. Exams are extremely difficult and do not pertain to material emphasized in class. Worst class I have ever taken due to this prof. Avoid taking any class with him. He is an incompetent lecturer.

AVOID! He is so unclear about what he is teaching. He never emphasized on what was important and would put completely random stuff on the exams than what was actually important. He keeps murmuring to himself and it's so so hard to concentrate. His TAs were very tough graders and if you took a doubt to him, he would never just be able to explain it.

This man should not be a professor. He says uhm every 30 seconds and cannot explain the simplest concepts. His exams are NOTHING like his lecture notes. He doesnt emphasize what is important in class as he is too busy stumbling over words. He is clearly confused by his own lecture notes, as he is unable to answer any questions posed in class.

MBB 231 is a dry, material heavy course that requires students to do a lot of rote memorization on their own time. Mike was clear on what would be tested and gave fair exams. Great prof, boring course.

He talks really fast in the lecture which makes it really difficult to understand. There's a lot to memorize. You will need to memorize even the most ridiculous name like glycosylphosphatidylinositol (no abbreviation). The grading scale is also crazily high. You will need 60% to pass and that's just a D.

He is awful. His lecture slides make no sense, he talks way too fast and is awful at explaining concepts. In terms of applying to exams the tutorials were a waste of time. MBB 231 has a lot of material and this course with any prof is time consuming,  but I feel like I had to spend so much more time  than needed on this course because of him

Goes through lecture material VERY fast but his exams are in super simple format, takes questions right out of the textbook. Course material is super dry, LOTS to memorize and read. Overall a very nice guy, willing to help and tutorials were a waste of time. All marks come from exams, no assignments or tutorial grades so be prepared to read
